contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=January 2010}} '''Otto Heilmann''' (22 August 1888, in [[Munich]] – 19 August 1945, at [[Schwaneck Castle]], [[Pullach]]) was a German [[architect]] and [[general contractor|contractor]]. After studying civil engineering, he joined his father's construction company [[Heilmann & Littmann]], as a proxy holding manager. Later he joined the supervisory board. ==External links== *[http://www.jakob-heilmann.de/Nachkommen/Jakob__Josefine_Hierl/Otto_Heilmann_sen_/otto_heilmann_sen_.html Otto Heilmann sen.] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Heilmann, Otto | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = German architect | DATE OF BIRTH = 22 August 1888 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 19 August 1945 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Heilmann, Otto}} [[Category:1888 births]] [[Category:1945 deaths]] [[Category:People from Munich]] [[Category:German businesspeople]] [[Category:German architects]] [[Category:Technical University Munich alumni]] {{Germany-architect-stub}} {{Germany-business-bio-stub}}
